title: What are some of the reasons that the far right is on the rise? - Quora

response.answer_text: Off the top of my head, I suspect: Rich people meddling in public opinion to oppose tax rises and to oppose the drop in profits to fossil fuel companies that would accompany any actual progress in the environmental movement. How the Koch brothers built the most powerful rightwing group you've never heard ofForeign powers meddling in other countries via internet trolls The Russian troll factory at the heart of the meddling allegationsBoth traditional and internet media that make money from sensationalism, either selling papers by vilifying minorities, or getting clicks by doing the same.That the status quo since the Thatcher/Reagan era has left increasing numbers of people behind, and has left public services tragically underfunded, and so people are turning away from the status quo, either to the moderately further left to find actual solutions, or to the far right to blame immigrants and other minorities.mainstream politicians reacting to all this by latching onto it, and fuelling those flames, in order to further their personal political agenda.I’m not sure what else. I’d say that it doesn’t matter in the grander scheme of things, apart from unspeakable personal and national tragedy, because it is just a blip in an otherwise clear and steady moral and social progress in history. However, the various environmental problems we face now are an existential threat, and can only be solved by an international effort, and not by countries that are destroying the international project. The various environmental projects will make every other problem worse, socially and economically, and pretty much in every way, so this is bad timing for a rise in the far right, really. Any ideas in how to remedy this would be appreciated.

Social media has much to do with this; it has allowed a whole range of wacko right-wing conspiracy theories to proliferate on-line. This development has been amplified by those conspiracy theories being aired on Fox News, by other media centres, and by right-wing ideologues.
